definition: to give one's allegiance/(popular) support
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: But everybody is clamouring for the First Lady.
sentences.chinese: 但大家一致拥戴第一夫人。

sentences.english: And as for 15 years, rice at permanent residents, the acclaimed by the mayor.
sentences.chinese: 又担任拉赖因堡15年常任市长，深受市民的拥戴。

sentences.english: Today, there are those who claim to have representatives of the Sion strain especially in the U.
sentences.chinese: 如今在美国有着许多拥戴西翁品系的无数代言人。

sentences.english: The professor's charisma must speak for itself. All the students love him.
sentences.chinese: 教授以自己的人格魅力，成为学生们拥戴的对象。
大家欢呼拥戴他为国王。

sentences.english: There's a Russian proverb that goes: you must support the most talented people because untalented people will support themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有一句俄罗斯谚语说，你须拥戴贤人，庸者仅会自顾。

sentences.english: Wang Yuanfeng gets common people support accordingly, should go up the county makes.
sentences.chinese: 王元丰因此得到百姓拥戴，当上县令。

sentences.english: They made him king of England.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥戴他为英国国王。

definition: to endorse/to support
to love and respect/love and respect
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to issue a call for action/to raise one's hand and issue a rousing call (idiom)
subject (of a kingdom, ruler etc)
to make a clarion call/to make a public appeal
to dote on and trust
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to put in an important position
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
popular sentiment
to endorse (sb for leader)
to vow loyalty and devotion to
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
to enjoy the confidence of the people/to be very popular
prestige
